Class Settings

  • java.lang.Object
    • Settings

  • public class Settings
extends java.lang.Object
    Settings class to set color of palyers.

        public static javafx.scene.paint.Color[] colorarr

    • Constructor Detail

      • Settings

        public Settings()

    • Method Detail

      • fillcolor

        public static void fillcolor()
        Static method fillcolor() to update color array according to user input. It will create three arrays R[],G[],B[] which will store values given by users in the textfield Then those values will be stored as Color object in colorarr. an OK button is also placed which on clicked will call dowork() method.

      • dowork

        public static void dowork(int[] R,
                          int[] G,
                          int[] B,
                          javafx.stage.Stage window,
                          javafx.scene.layout.Pane layout,
                          javafx.scene.control.TextField[][] txt)
        Parameters:
        R - takes parameter R as array of Red values of color inputted by user
        G - takes parameter G as array of Green values of color inputted by user
        B - takes parameter B as array of Blue values of color inputted by user
        window - main window taken as parameter to close it if two players have same rgb values which will be checked by check(R,G,B) method
        layout - main layout sent as argument to add a label to prompt about same colors of players
        txt - a TextField[][] array to extract value from it inputted by user

      • check

        public static boolean check(int[] R,
                            int[] G,
                            int[] B)
        Parameters:
        R - R takes parameter R as array of Red values of color inputted by user
        G - G takes parameter G as array of Green values of color inputted by user
        B - B takes parameter B as array of Blue values of color inputted by user
        Returns:
        returns true if there is no issue of having same color for more than 1 palyer, otherwise false
